summary: Isn't Christianity just a bunch of rules?
location: Queen Mary University of London, Mile End Rd, London E1 4NS, UK
description:
You are warmly invited to enjoy some free cake and a short talk, exploring an aspect of the Christian faith.

We'll be in the Blomeley rooms everyday from Monday to Friday, looking at these questions. They'll be plenty of time to ask your own questions too; and as we hear people's stories, maybe share some of yours too.

Everyone is welcome to come along. What's your story?

For more info, follow us on Facebook at @QMchristianunion and @storylondon2018.

description:

We'll be in the chapel each lunchtime from Monday to Thursday, looking at these questions. They'll be plenty of time to ask your own questions; and as we hear people's stories, maybe share some of yours too.

summary: Travelling Canvas (University of the Arts London CU)
description: At lunchtimes this week UAL CU are taking a travelling canvas around the colleges. We'll be asking about your stories and treating it as an interactive art work/community project. Find us in visible spaces around UAL!

summary: Ruth Naomi Floyd: The Roots of Jazz
location: All Souls Langham Place, 2 All Souls' Pl, Marylebone, London W1B 3DA, UK
description:
Come and join us for a night of live jazz, performed by some fabulous jazzy people! There will also be some tasty grub for you to get your teeth into, so don't miss out!

Interviewee: Ruth Naomi Floyd creates vocal jazz that expresses Christian theology, some of which she will be performing to us tonight! Originally from Philadelphia, a daughter of urban missionaries, she became a Christian when she was young and now shares her faith through her music. 


This will be followed by a short talk from our speaker of the week... Richard Cunningham 

We would love to see you there, all welcome! 

Food and coffee from 7pm
Programme starts at 7.30pm 

@storylondon2018

summary: An hour with Ruth Naomi Floyd
location: Guildhall School of Music & Drama, London EC2Y, UK
description:
American jazz singer Ruth Naomi Floyd has a powerful story to share. Join us this lunchtime, to meet Ruth and to hear a free teaser for her gig at Story central this evening. We'll also start to unpack what it is that makes her story so special.

*Free lunch provided*

summary: Stories of Freedom
location: Royal Academy of Music, Marylebone Rd, Marylebone, London NW1 5HT, UK
description:
Am I free? Do I feel free? What is real freedom?

Join us this lunchtime as we explore the idea of freedom. There'll be a chance to share your own stories and ideas, as well as to hear and explore Jesus Christ's own offer of true freedom. 

*Free lunch provided*

summary: Stories of Freedom
location: Guildhall School of Music & Drama, London EC2Y, UK
description:
Am I free? Do I feel free? What is real freedom?

*Free lunch provided*

summary: Stories of suffering
location: Royal Academy of Music, Marylebone Rd, Marylebone, London NW1 5HT, UK
description:
Why do we suffer? Is there meaning in our pain? Can we find hope?

Together we'll explore the topic suffering. Share your stories and ideas, or just listen in on the conversation. There'll be an explanation of the hope that Jesus claims to offer through suffering too.

*Free lunch provided*

summary: Billy McCurrie: The Former Terrorist
location: All Souls Langham Place, 2 All Souls' Pl, Marylebone, London W1B 3DA, UK
description:
For the final event, Billy McCurrie will be sharing the story of how he went from being a UVF terrorist to a baptist pastor! It's gonna to be a good one!

Interviewee: Billy McCurrie was just 16 when he joined Ulster Volunteer Force, and Irish terror group that emerged in the 1960's. At the age of 17 he was sentenced to life in prison after killing a man to avenge his fathers murder. Now he is a baptist minister preaching peace in Ormskirk, near Liverpool. Pop along to learn more about this incredible story! 

This will be followed by a short talk from our speaker for the week... Richard Cunningham

Food and coffee from 7pm
Programme starts at 7.30pm

@StoryLondon2018

summary: Baroness Cox: The Humanitarian
location: All Souls Langham Place, 2 All Souls' Pl, Marylebone, London W1B 3DA, UK
description:
Ever met a baroness? Well tonight is the night! Come and hear the story of a humanitarian baroness, and indulge in some delicious food too! 

Interviewee: Baroness Cox has a lavish Wikipedia page. From it I have learnt that she is a cross bench member of the House of Lords, CEO and founder of many charities, and Baroness-in-Waiting to Queen Elizabeth II. Is there anything she hasn't done? Pop along and find out!

This will be followed by a short talk by our speaker of the week... Richard Cunningham! (He's not a Baron but we forgive him)

Please come, the more the merrier!

Food and coffee from 7pm
Programme starts at 7.30pm

@StoryLondon2018

summary: Tim Cross: The Major General
location: All Souls Langham Place, 2 All Souls' Pl, Marylebone, London W1B 3DA, UK
description:
Tonight we're sending ground control to Major Tim, because Major Tom was already booked up! 

Tuesday promises to be a divine night filled with food, fun and a story from a major general, so take your protein pills and put your helmet on! 

Interviewee: Major General Tim Cross is a retired British army officer and military logistics expert. He has commanded at every level, from leading a small Bomb Disposal Team in Northern Ireland in the 1970s, to commanding a Division of 30,000 in 2004/07. Cross has also advised the former Prime Minister Tony Blair on the invasion of Iraq! Don't miss the story of how Tim's faith has been the driving force for a fruitful career!

This will be followed by a short talk from our speaker of the week... Richard Cunningham

All are welcome!

Food and coffee from 7pm
Programme starts at 7.30pm

@StoryLondon2018
